title: Alcibíades Rojas
text:
Alcibíades Rojas McRay (born 15 August 1986) is a former Panamanian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player.
Club career.
Nicknamed "Pepón", Rojas has played the majority of his career in his native Panama, but also had spells with Colombian side <a href="Academia%20F.C.">Academia</a>, <a href="Juventud%20Retalteca">Juventud Retalteca</a> in Guatemala and Honduran outfit <a href="C.D.%20Victoria">Victoria</a>.
In June 2013 he joined reigning champions <a href="Sporting%20San%20Miguelito">Sporting SM</a> and after his time in jail returned to Chorrillo. In December 2014 he was snapped up by <a href="San%20Francisco%20F.C.">San Francisco</a>, only to be released by the club ahead of the 2015 Apertura.
International career.
Rojas made his debut for <a href="Panama%20national%20football%20team">Panama</a> in a January 2013 <a href="friendly%20match">friendly match</a> against <a href="Guatemala%20national%20football%20team">Guatemala</a> and has, as of November 2013, earned a total of 6 caps, scoring 1 goal. He has represented his country in 2 <a href="FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification">FIFA World Cup qualification</a> matches and at the <a href="2013%20Copa%20Centroamericana">2013 Copa Centroamericana</a>.
Arrested on kidnapping allegations.
On 16 November 2013, Rojas was arrested by Panamanian police after they captured an alleged gang of kidnappers, Rojas being one of them. In April 2014 he announced his return to professional football after spending several months in prison.
